title: Chanel: the verdict on Virginie Viard’s first ready-to-wear show without Karl Lagerfeld
text:
For someone who was recently entrusted with the biggest job in fashion, Virginie Viard, Karl Lagerfeld’s successor at Chanel, doesn’t seem to feel she has much to prove. At least not in a hurry.

Her spring/ summer 2020 ready-to-wear show was not so much a big statement about new intentions, as an exercise in subtraction.

Gone are all the jokey accessories and off-kilter styling from Lagerfeld’s era. Instead this collection offered a laboratory-like examination of the Chanel codes that Lagerfeld endlessly played with, sometimes to the point of affectionate parody.
